Biological sex is a **input factor**. It means that it is one of the inputs from the user to the model.

#### Alternative names:
* Sex
* Biological sex

#### Uses

Biological sex is used by the model in the following places

* as a risk factor for [Breast cancer](/model/BreastCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Cervix cancer](/model/CervixCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Liver cancer](/model/LiverCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Ovary cancer](/model/OvaryCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Prostate cancer](/model/ProstateCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Uterus cancer](/model/UterusCancer)
* as a risk factor for [Childbirth](/model/Childbirth)
* to compute [Waist circumference as male](/model/WaistMale)

#### Guidance

The user input is chosen from a list and should answer the question

> What is your biological sex?

The user has the following answer options

* Male
* Female


### Optimizability

[Optimizability](/model/optimizabilities) is a subjective measure used to describe how easy it is to optimize a certain factor of your life. The optimizability of Biological sex is [1](/model/optimizabilities#category-1). This means that it can be interpreted as



> *It is impossible to change and it has never been in your control*
